meanings.definition: sices (verb): to cut into small pieces
meanings.sent1: She sices the vegetables for the salad.
meanings.sent2: The chef sices the onions for the soup.
meanings.sent3: The little girl sices her sandwich into tiny squares.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor sices the clay with precision.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the knife sicing through the bread filled the kitchen.

meanings.definition: sices (noun): a small fragment or piece
meanings.sent1: He found sices of glass scattered on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The mosaic was made of colorful sices of tile.
meanings.sent3: The child collected sices of seashells along the shore.
meanings.sent4: The artist used sices of paper to create a collage.
meanings.sent5: The detective carefully examined the sices of evidence at the crime scene.
